review: I bought the FireTVStick after using ChromeCast for a few months. For me, the attraction was that it has its own remote. ChromeCast requires you to use your iPhone which tends to either go to sleep or lock so that when you want to pause the video play, it can take up to 20 seconds before you can get it to respond.The Firestick does solve this problem but adds quite a few of its own. The interface is clunky at best and at least the Netflix app is pretty weak. You cannot even search for a movie by its title. The interface seems to exist primarily to sell Amazon Prime.In addition, the Firestick firmware is not very stable. For example, I installed the Airplay app they sell to allow you to play videos from your iPhone. Not only would it not play sound from iPhone videos, it crashed the Netflix app and I had to uninstall it their AirPlay app.Probably not ready for prime time.
